text:
is an underwater volcano (seamount) of the Hawaiian–Emperor seamount chain in the Pacific Ocean. Kammu is an extinct volcano.
The seamount is also known as the "Kammu Guyot" because it has a flat top. This undersea geologic feature is also called a "guyot" or "tablemount".
This seabed mountain is named after Emperor Kammu of Japan.
The last eruption from Kammu seamount is unknown.
